title: June 11, 2024—KB5039214 (OS Build 14393.7070) - Microsoft Support
text:
June 11, 2024—KB5039214 (OS Build 14393.7070) 
Windows 10, version 1607, all editions 
Windows Server 2016, all editions

For information about Windows update terminology, see the article about the  
types of Windows updates 
 and the  
monthly quality update types 
. For an overview of  Windows 10, version 1607, see its  
update history page 
. 
Highlights 
This update addresses security issues for your Windows operating system. 
Improvements 
This security update includes quality improvements. When you install this KB: 
This update addresses an issue that affects  
lsass.exe 
. It stops responding. This occurs after you install the April 2024 security updates on Windows servers. 
This update addresses an issue that affects  
lsass.exe 
. It leaks memory. This occurs during a Local Security Authority (Domain Policy) Remote Protocol (LSARPC) call. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the new  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
June 2024 Security Updates 
. 
Known issues in this update 
Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update. 
How to get this update 
Before installing this update 
Microsoft strongly recommends you install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) for your operating system before installing the latest cumulative update (LCU). SSUs improve the reliability of the update process to mitigate potential issues while installing the LCU and applying Microsoft security updates. For general information about SSUs, see  
Servicing stack updates 
 and  
Servicing Stack Updates (SSU): Frequently Asked Questions 
. 
If you are using Windows Update, the latest SSU ( 
KB5039334 
) will be offered to you automatically. To get the standalone package for the latest SSU, search for it in the  
Microsoft Update Catalog 
. 
Install this update 
To install this update, use one of the following Windows and Microsoft release channels.

summary:
KB5039214 is a security update released on June 11, 2024, aimed at Windows 10 version 1607 and Windows Server 2016 across all editions. This update addresses critical issues affecting the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (lsass.exe), specifically stopping its response and causing memory leaks during LSARPC calls after the installation of the April 2024 security updates. Administrators are recommended to install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) KB5039334 prior to applying the cumulative update for optimal reliability during installation. No known issues with this update have been reported by Microsoft.

**Technical Breakdown**

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
- This update addresses high-impact vulnerabilities related to `lsass.exe`, including:
  - Non-responsiveness of `lsass.exe` after April 2024 updates.
  - Memory leak issues during LSARPC communication.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- Before installing KB5039214:
  1. Ensure that SSU KB5039334 is installed. This improves the update installation process.
  2. The SSU can be acquired automatically via Windows Update, or manually from the Microsoft Update Catalog.

- Installation Channels:
  - **Windows Update**: Automatic installation.
  - **Windows Update for Business**: Follows configured policies for automatic installation.
  - **Standalone Installer**: Obtainable from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
  - **WSUS**: Automatically syncs if configured for Windows 10 and security updates.

- Example command for manual installation of SSU:
  ```
  [Powershell]
  ```powershell
  Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://download.microsoft.com/path/to/KB5039334" -OutFile "C:\path\to\downloaded\SSU.msu"
  ```

- No specific uninstallation instructions for this update have been provided in the KB article.
